revised_title: Investigating the 'Blaze-Currents' of the Gall Bladder of the Frog
tldr: The authors study the electrical responses exhibited by the gall bladder of the frog, discovering that it consistently displays antidrome 'blaze-currents' in response to stimulation. These currents are abolished by boiling the gall bladder or exposure to chloroform vapor, suggesting a local, temperature-sensitive origin.
